title: Test Your Understanding: JavaScript Destructuring
description: See how well you understood the concepts in this post!

questions.question: What syntax does array destructuring use?
questions.explanation: Array destructuring uses square brackets [] to extract values by position.

questions.question: What syntax does object destructuring use?
questions.explanation: Object destructuring uses curly braces {} to extract values by property name.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid destructuring patterns?
questions.explanation: Arrays use [] and objects use {}. Mixing them won't work correctly.

questions.question: You can skip elements in array destructuring by leaving empty spaces.
questions.explanation: True! You can skip elements using empty spaces: const [first, , third] = array

questions.question: What happens if you destructure a property that doesn't exist?
questions.explanation: Destructuring a non-existent property returns undefined. Use default values to handle this: const { name = 'Unknown' } = user
